prefectures.name: Hokkaido
prefectures.interestingFact: It's known for its snowy landscapes and skiing resorts.
prefectures.food: Jingisukan (grilled mutton), seafood (crab, uni), soup curry

prefectures.name: Aomori
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for its Nebuta Festival with giant illuminated floats.

prefectures.name: Iwate
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to the famous wanko soba noodle challenge.

prefectures.name: Miyagi
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for gyutan (grilled beef tongue) and the Tanabata festival.

prefectures.name: Akita
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for Akita dogs and Kiritanpo hot pot.

prefectures.name: Yamagata
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for delicious cherries and Zao snow monsters.

prefectures.name: Fukushima
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to the Aizu samurai culture and scenic Ouchi-juku.

prefectures.name: Ibaraki
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for the Kairakuen Garden and natto (fermented soybeans).

prefectures.name: Tochigi
prefectures.interestingFact: Nikko, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located here.

prefectures.name: Gunma
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for hot springs like Kusatsu and Daruma dolls.

prefectures.name: Saitama
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to Kawagoe, a town with Edo-period architecture.

prefectures.name: Chiba
prefectures.interestingFact: Narita International Airport is located here.

prefectures.name: Tokyo
prefectures.interestingFact: The most populated metropolitan area in the world.

prefectures.name: Kanagawa
prefectures.interestingFact: Yokohama has Japan's largest Chinatown.

prefectures.name: Niigata
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for high-quality rice and sake production.

prefectures.name: Toyama
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for the breathtaking Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route.

prefectures.name: Ishikawa
prefectures.interestingFact: Kanazawa has one of Japan's most beautiful gardens, Kenrokuen.

prefectures.name: Fukui
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to the famous Eiheiji Zen temple and dinosaur fossils.

prefectures.name: Yamanashi
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for Mt. Fuji views and grape production.

prefectures.name: Nagano
prefectures.interestingFact: Hosted the 1998 Winter Olympics and has the famous snow monkeys.

prefectures.name: Gifu
prefectures.interestingFact: Shirakawa-go, a UNESCO site, is known for its thatched-roof houses.

prefectures.name: Shizuoka
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for green tea and the best views of Mt. Fuji.

prefectures.name: Aichi
prefectures.interestingFact: Nagoya is the birthplace of Toyota.
prefectures.food: Miso katsu, hitsumabushi (grilled eel over rice)

prefectures.name: Mie
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to Ise Shrine, Japan's most sacred Shinto shrine.

prefectures.name: Shiga
prefectures.interestingFact: Lake Biwa, Japan's largest lake, is located here.

prefectures.name: Kyoto
prefectures.interestingFact: Kyoto has over 2,000 temples and shrines.

prefectures.name: Osaka
prefectures.interestingFact: Known as the 'Kitchen of Japan' for its street food.

prefectures.name: Hyogo
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for Kobe beef and Himeji Castle.

prefectures.name: Nara
prefectures.interestingFact: Nara has free-roaming deer at its parks and temples.

prefectures.name: Wakayama
prefectures.interestingFact: Mount Koya is a major Buddhist pilgrimage site.

prefectures.name: Tottori
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to Japan's largest sand dunes.

prefectures.name: Shimane
prefectures.interestingFact: Izumo Taisha is one of Japan's oldest shrines.

prefectures.name: Okayama
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for the legend of Momotaro (Peach Boy).

prefectures.name: Hiroshima
prefectures.interestingFact: Site of the first atomic bomb attack in 1945.

prefectures.name: Yamaguchi
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for the Kintai Bridge and fugu (pufferfish) cuisine.

prefectures.name: Tokushima
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for the Awa Odori dance festival.

prefectures.name: Kagawa
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for Sanuki udon noodles.

prefectures.name: Ehime
prefectures.interestingFact: Dogo Onsen is one of Japan's oldest hot springs.

prefectures.name: Kochi
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for the Yosakoi dance festival.

prefectures.name: Fukuoka
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for its Hakata ramen and lively yatai (food stalls).

prefectures.name: Saga
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for Arita and Imari porcelain.

prefectures.name: Nagasaki
prefectures.interestingFact: The only place in Japan with European-style history.

prefectures.name: Kumamoto
prefectures.interestingFact: Home to Kumamoto Castle and the cute mascot Kumamon.

prefectures.name: Oita
prefectures.interestingFact: Famous for Beppu, Japan's top hot spring resort.

prefectures.name: Miyazaki
prefectures.interestingFact: Known for Takachiho Gorge and myths of Japan's origins.

prefectures.name: Kagoshima
prefectures.interestingFact: Sakurajima volcano is still active near the city.

prefectures.name: Okinawa
prefectures.interestingFact: Okinawa has a distinct Ryukyu culture and long life expectancy.
prefectures.food: Goya champuru, Okinawa soba, taco rice
